docs.snippet: Dickey, entering his second season pitching for the Toronto Blue Jays, hopes to rebound from a mediocre 2013 season....
docs.lead_paragraph: Dickey, entering his second season pitching for the Toronto Blue Jays, hopes to rebound from a mediocre 2013 season.
docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column highlights Toronto Blue Jays pitcher R A Dickey, who hopes to improve on mediocre 2013 season as he enters his second year with Toronto; notes that Dickey continues to correspond with fans who were inspired by his memoir, which acknowledged that he was sexually abused as a child.

headline.main: A Body of Work R. A. Dickey Prefers as His Legacy
headline.print_headline: A Body of Work Dickey Prefers as His Legacy

docs.snippet: Eduardo Nunez is no longer considered exclusively a shortstop as the Yankees have big openings to fill at second and third base....
docs.lead_paragraph: Eduardo Nunez is no longer considered exclusively a shortstop as the Yankees have big openings to fill at second and third base.
docs.abstract: New York Yankees shortstop Eduardo Nunez, once the heir apparent to Derek Jeter, is being considered for other positions as team seeks to fill big openings; manager Joe Girardi has indicated that Nunez could become second or third baseman.

headline.main: Once Heir Apparent at Shortstop, Nunez Joins Crowd at Second and Third
headline.print_headline: Once Heir Apparent at Shortstop, Nunez Joins Crowd at Second and Third

docs.snippet: Manny Banuelos, who had Tommy John elbow surgery on October 4, 2012, gave up three runs in two-thirds of an inning, but the Yankees have not forgotten how impressive he was in early 2011....
docs.lead_paragraph: Manny Banuelos, who had Tommy John elbow surgery on October 4, 2012, gave up three runs in two-thirds of an inning, but the Yankees have not forgotten how impressive he was in early 2011.

headline.main: Tough Outing for Banuelos, but Good Sign for Yankees
headline.print_headline: Tough Outing for Banuelos, but Good Sign for Yankees

docs.snippet: Over three innings, Noah Syndergaard issued three walks, allowed two hits and surrendered two runs....
docs.lead_paragraph: Over three innings, Noah Syndergaard issued three walks, allowed two hits and surrendered two runs.
docs.abstract: New York Mets top pitching prospect Noah Syndergaard turns in shaky performance in preseason game against the Detroit Tigers.

headline.print_headline: Mets’ Top Prospect Has Shaky Outing but Remains Upbeat

docs.lead_paragraph: The St. Louis Cardinals and third baseman Matt Carpenter have agreed to a six-year, $52 million contract, the team said.

docs.snippet: Wendell Smith, a reporter for a black newspaper, advised and pressed Branch Rickey in numerous private letters on the signing of Robinson....
docs.lead_paragraph: Wendell Smith, a reporter for a black newspaper, advised and pressed Branch Rickey in numerous private letters on the signing of Robinson.
docs.abstract: Wendell Smith, reporter for prominent black newspaper The Pittsburgh Courier in the 1940s, advised and pressed Brooklyn Dodgers president Branch Rickey in numerous letters about the signing of Jackie Robinson; Smith, who also played amateur baseball, was posthumously inducted into the Baseball Hall of Fame in 1993.

headline.main: Hall of Famer Whose Pen Charted Path for Jackie Robinson
headline.print_headline: Hall of Famer Whose Pen Charted Path for Robinson

docs.snippet: Thorne, the veteran TV play-by-play man, took time out from calling Baltimore Orioles games to do a high school hockey tournament in Minnesota....
docs.lead_paragraph: Thorne, the veteran TV play-by-play man, took time out from calling Baltimore Orioles games to do a high school hockey tournament in Minnesota.
docs.abstract: Gary Thorne, veteran play-by-play announcer who is beginning his eighth season on Baltimore Orioles telecasts, takes time out from his schedule to call a semifinal match in the Minnesota high school boys hockey tournament for local channel.

headline.main: Gary Thorne in Full Voice for High School Event
headline.print_headline: Thorne Handles High School Hockey Like a Pro

docs.snippet: GALE--Daniel Kent, a lifelong resident of Huntington, NY passed away on March 5, 2014. Born December 13, 1917. Chairman, Daniel Gale Sotheby's International Realty, founded in 1922 by his father, Daniel Gale. Widely recognized and respected for ir...
docs.lead_paragraph: GALE--Daniel Kent, a lifelong resident of Huntington, NY passed away on March 5, 2014. Born December 13, 1917. Chairman, Daniel Gale Sotheby's International Realty, founded in 1922 by his father, Daniel Gale. Widely recognized and respected for ironclad values, integrity and ingenuity. For all his business success, he counted his loving family as his greatest accomplishment. Married 70 years to Jean Wallice (July 27, 1943). At Huntington High School played Varsity football, basketball, track, baseball. A superb bridge player who played with skill and enthusiasm into his 90s. Lifetime member, Rotary International, maintained perfect attendance while professionally active. Member, Huntington Country Club. WWII veteran, stationed at Schofield Barracks (Oahu) during Pearl Harbor attack. Completed "90 Day Wonder" officer training. Earned Captain, served in Panama. In 1955 and 1956 named top sales representative, North America, Travelers Insurance. Assumed leadership of Daniel Gale Agency from his father in the mid-1950s, was early leader in the Long Island Board of Realtors and Multiple Listing Service of Long Island. In 1976, Daniel Gale became affiliated with Sotheby's. Today Daniel Gale Sotheby's is a $2.5 billion dollar organization with nearly 600 sales associates/22 sales offices spanning Long Island. It consistently leads the nation in achieving one of the highest average sales prices in the country. Cherished husband of Jean (nee Wallice). Devoted father of Danny Gale, Stanley C. Gale and Mary Stokkers, grandfather to Kelly Stokkers, Aly Stokkers McKee, Kyle Stokkers, Stanley Gale Jr., Katherine Gale, Jaclyn Gale; great-grandfather to Brinley McKee.

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  GALE, DANIEL KENT
